titleStmt.title: A true and perfect account of a strange and dreadful apparition which lately infested and sunk a ship bound for New-Castle, called the Hope-well of London and of the strange deliverance of John Pye, master, and nine men more, who were all examined and sworn to the truth of the following relation before Justice Wood of London.
titleStmt.author: Pye, John, Master.

titleStmt.title: A true and perfect account of a strange and dreadful apparition which lately infested and sunk a ship bound for New-Castle, called the Hope-well of London and of the strange deliverance of John Pye, master, and nine men more, who were all examined and sworn to the truth of the following relation before Justice Wood of London.
titleStmt.author: Pye, John, Master.
Jemson, Nathaniel.

notesStmt.note: Also attributed to Nathaniel Jemson. Cf. Wing.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
